intro: Zaluzianskya distans, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant has a low-growing, mat-forming structure with narrow, fleshy leaves adapted to conserve water. Its yellow flowers bloom in spring, and it produces small, wind-dispersed seeds. Zaluzianskya distans is well-suited to harsh environments and is often found in sandy or rocky soils.
